text: Academic, social and career assistance for students with learning disabilities
The Academic Support Center (ASC) empowers students to succeed academically and socially – providing an additional roadmap to a meaningful post-graduate career. Our four-pillared approach is
Each ASC student receives comprehensive personalized services including:
Weekly progress monitoring and ongoing organizational support
Unlimited, individualized, subject-specific tutoring by degreed professionals
Specialized First Year seminar enhanced by a partnership with the Cleveland Clinic and other local resources
One on one career training and workshops to develop employability skills
Social and volunteer opportunities for interested students
Discover the difference up close and see why so many students choose the ASC.
Enrolled Notre Dame College students with a documented learning disability.
The Academic Support Center provides personalized support and services, exceeding those required by law, to degree-seeking students with documented disabilities for academic and career success.
© 2020                                Notre Dame College Academic Support Center
Educating a diverse population in the liberal arts
For personal, professional and global responsibility
In the tradition of the Sisters of Notre Dame

Notre Dame College Continues Speaker Series for Students, Community

Notre Dame College continues its “From ME 2 WE” speaker series with a national health advocate and an Emmy Award winning news anchor in February 2020. The theme of the series that started in the fall semester illustrates Notre Dame’s distinctive campus culture in...
